description.narrative: Climate Change Mitigation: The Project will promote a positive climate change agenda by displacing thermal power generation and reducing associated carbon emissions. Promoting private investment into the private sector: By providing a critical demonstration effect of financial feasibility of the first large scale grid-connected solar PV projects in Honduras, the Project will support GoH''s ongoing efforts to increase private participation in the energy sector, as evidenced in the ongoing unbundling and privatization activities.

SunEdison HON3 (the Project) comprises the development, construction and operation of 3 solar PV power plants (the Sub-Projects) located in two clusters in the southern region of Choluteca, Honduras. With 80.8MWp of installed capacity, the capital expenditure required to implement the Project total approximately US$200 million. Participaciones Choluteca Dos S.A. (the Company), a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of SunEdison, Inc. (SunEdison or the Sponsor), is developing the 3 solar PV power plants through two fully-owned Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs) and has successfully secured 20-year Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) with state-owned utility, Empresa Nacional de Energia Eletrica (ENEE). The PPAs, which include a special solar incentive, are part of a wider effort by ENEE and the Government of Honduras to diversify the countrys electricity supply and improve the reliability of the power grid. SunEdison will employ equipment (e.g. panels, inverters, trackers) from top-class manufacturers and expects to start construction of the Sub-Projects in Q4 of 2014 supported by an intercompany Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contract. The Sub-Projects are expected to become operational by the second half of 2015.

name.narrative: The Projects solar panel arrays will be located in two sites across the southern region of Choluteca. Both power plant clusters will connect to the nearby Santa Lucia substation.
